pr_title: Add DynamicRealm.createEmbeddedObject + add check for invalid Realm model types

timeline.message: Added check for incompatible model types when creating an embedded object

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to lift this check outside the switch? I'm not 100% sure how it would affect the default branch here.
timeline.author: edualonso

replies.bodyText: yeah, lifting it out would not work for the default branch, the default branch catches things like INTEGER and BOOLEAN... Not sure what would happen in that case?
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: What happens if the parentPropotype is not a link? There seems to be a missing test for it?
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: What is returned if the property is not a Link or List? ... Right now getPropertyType sounds similar to getFieldType() which returns the type of the Field... maybe rename this to getLinkedType() which will throw an illegal state exception with something like "Field does not contain a link, but X" kind of error if the field doesn't contain a link
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText:
This implementation is a bit problematic to have in RealmObjectSchema .. methods in here should work for both DynamicRealm and Realm instances, but ColumnInfo doesn't exist for DynamicRealms. I think this implementation should be in ImmutableRealmObjectSchema instead and we
need another implementation for the MutableRealmObjectSchema.
Since this is part of the public API we also need tests specifically for this outside the context of createEmbeddedObject
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.message: Added embedded object creation for dynamic realms and some tests
Modified proxy class generator to incorporate changes in row.createEmbeddedObject method signature

timeline.bodyText: I suspect we will never hit this as parentObjectSchema.getLinkedType(parentProperty); will throw first. We should probably move the linkedType property into the switch?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: That's right, and also having parentProperty as final makes the switch statement useless. Good catch.
replies.author: edualonso

timeline.bodyText: I think we we should use DynamicRealmObject here. By using RealmModel it opens up for people accidentially using their typed model classes
timeline.author: cmelchior
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -160,6 +164,51 @@ public DynamicRealmObject createObject(String className, Object primaryKeyValue) CheckedRow.getFromRow(OsObject.createWithPrimaryKey(table, primaryKeyValue))); } + /** + * Instantiates and adds a new embedded object to the Realm. + *

+ * This method should only be used to create objects of types marked as embedded. + * + * @param className the class name of the object to create. + * @param parentObject The parent object which should hold a reference to the embedded object. + * If the parent property is a list the embedded object will be added to the + * end of that list. + * @param parentProperty the property in the parent class which holds the reference. + * @return the newly created embedded object. + * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code clazz} is not an embedded class or if the property + * in the parent class cannot hold objects of the appropriate type. + * @see RealmClass#embedded() + */ + public DynamicRealmObject createEmbeddedObject(String className, + RealmModel parentObject,

timeline.bodyText: This cast can be avoided if the above is fixed.
timeline.author: cmelchior
cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: This Javadoc doesn't seem entirely accurate. It will return the linked type regardless of classes being embedded or not.
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: I think it makes sense. I will change it to return the class name regardless of which object it is called upon and then move the assertion for a valid type to the createEmbeddedObject method. But then I don't think this method needs to be made public, as it's used only internally. I will make it package protected instead.
replies.author: edualonso

timeline.bodyText: Since this is a new method in the public API we should also have tests for this directly instead of indirectly through other methods.
timeline.author: cmelchior
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -462,6 +462,25 @@ public void setEmbedded(boolean embedded) {
         }
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Checks whether a given class property can represent a valid embedded object
+     * {@code @LinkingObjects} backlink that points to a parent. Valid embedded object backlink
+     * typs are {@link RealmFieldType#OBJECT} and {@link RealmFieldType#LIST}.
+     *
+     * @param linkingProperty the field for which we want to know the type.
+     * @return the name of the property.
+     * @throws IllegalStateException if the given property is not found in the schema or the
+     * backlink property is not a valid type.
+     */
+    public abstract String getLinkedType(String linkingProperty);

replies.bodyText: I have re-thought this method and it can be for internal use only.
replies.author: edualonso

timeline.author: cmelchior
cmelchior

timeline.message: Addressed comments after code review: made methods that deal with property class names and their assertions package private in RealmObjectSchema, fixed typos here and there and improved documentation
